DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the visual results of patients with keratoconus treated with one of two techniques: penetrating keratoplasty (PK) vs. pachymetry and Excimer laser assisted lamellar keratoplasty (PALK).
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Keratoconus With PALK Versus PK
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of keratoconus grades III or IV in the Amsler Krumeich classification. Need of surgical procedure No endothelial scar Best corrected visual acuity <20/40 Contact lens intolerance Imagenological map pachymetric acquisition over 90% at 9 mm corneal diameter Contraindication for any of the techniques evaluated. Requiring additional surgical procedures. Diagnostic of other ectasia that were not primary keratoconus.
